featured.text: Which of the following is true about Cartier-Bresson’s approach to photography?
Educated in Paris, Cartier-Bresson developed an early love for literature and the arts.

Cartier-Bresson’s family was wealthy—his father made a fortune as a textile manufacturer—but Cartier-Bresson later joked that due to his parents’ frugal ways, it often seemed as though his family was poor.
As a teenager, Cartier-Bresson rebelled against his parents’ formal ways of education.
Cartier-Bresson’s subsequent work to document Gandhi’s death and its immediate impact on the country became one of Life Magazine’s most prized photo essays.

other.text: Cartier-Bresson’s approach to photography remained much the same throughout his life.
Which of the following best describes Cartier-Bresson’s family background?
What significance did Cartier-Bresson have to Gandhi of India?
Which of the following is true about Cartier-Bresson’s career in photography?
The naturalist in Cartier-Bresson believed that all editing should be done when the photo is taken.
Cartier-Bresson traveled to Africa in 1931 to hunt antelope and boar.

definition.zh_def: 布雷松（Bresson）是一位法國電影導演，以其獨特的電影風格和對現實主義的追求而聞名。
definition.en_def: Bresson refers to Robert Bresson, a French film director known for his distinctive style and emphasis on realism in cinema.
definition.example: Robert Bresson's films often explore themes of spirituality and morality.
